bibl.title: Letter from Honorato Colete to Philip Showalter Hench, June 22, 1948

div1.p: Colete informs Hench that he and others visited various Cuban government offices, and that they believe the work to preserve Camp Lazear will begin soon. The government will not accept Hench's offer of $1000 for immediate preservation efforts on Building No. 1.

div1.head: Letter from Honorato Colete to Philip Showalter Hench, June 22, 1948
div1.opener:
HONORATO COLETE
ARQUITECTO · INGENIERO CIVIL
URBANISMO Y PLANEACION
HABANA 254. - A-9529. - HABANA - CUBA
Havana, June 22, 1948.
Dr. Philip S. Hench.
Mayo Clinic.
Rochester, Minnesota.
My dear Dr. Hench:-
div1.p:
Please excuse my delay in answering your
letter of May 5, 1948, that I hope you will accept knowing
that until yesterday nothing could be done.

Yesterday Dr. Cardenas, Dr. Carbonell, Dr.
Andreu and I went through different offices trying to know
something about the money appropiated. I think that our visit
was good enough because we knew that the Ministery is interes-
ted enough and that the work will be started soon.

Almost any one of us could show a letter
from you which was very impressing and of course the Govern-
ment will not accept your offering, that we thanks very much,
for protecting the caseta with a sort of shed.

Early in July I am sure I will be able to
give you concrete news about your interes.

I have not forgotten the air views you are
interested in but until now I have fail to get them.
div1.closer: Yours very truly, H Colete HC:mra.
